summary.long: Haggai is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: On the first day of the sixth month of the second year of the reign of King Darius, this message from the Lord came by Haggai the prophet to Shealtiel’s son Zerubbabel, governor of Judah, and to Jehozadak’s son Joshua, the high priest:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what the Lord of the Heavenly Armies says: ‘These people keep saying, “No, the right time for rebuilding the Lord’s Temple has not yet come.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then this message from the Lord came by Haggai the prophet:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Is it the right time for all of you to live in your own paneled houses while this house remains in ruins?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now this is what the Lord of the Heavenly Armies, says: ‘Carefully consider your ways:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have sowed much
    but have reaped little.
You have eaten
    but don’t have enough to become satisfied.
You have drunk
    but don’t have enough to become intoxicated.
You have clothed yourself
    but don’t have enough to keep warm.
And the hired laborer deposits his salary
    in a bag full of holes!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what the Lord of the Heavenly Armies says: ‘Carefully consider your ways:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go up into the mountains, bring timber, and reconstruct my house. Then I will be pleased with it and I will be honored,’ says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘You turned away in pursuit of abundance, but look at how little you found! What you did manage to bring home, I blew away! And why?’ declares the Lord of the Heavenly Armies. ‘It’s because of my house! It lies in ruins while each of you runs off to his own house!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is why the heavens keep withholding dew from you, and the earth withholds her fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I sent a drought on the land, on the mountains, on your grain, on your new wines, on your oil—on everything the ground produces—on men, on livestock, and on everything you do!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Shealtiel’s son Zerubbabel, Jehozadak’s son Joshua the high priest, and all the rest of the people obeyed the Lord their God and the words of Haggai the prophet, because the Lord their God had sent him. And the people feared the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Haggai, the messenger of the Lord, spoke to the people with a special commission from the Lord: “‘I am with you,’ declares the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord revitalized the spirit of Shealtiel’s son Zerubbabel, governor of Judah, the spirit of Jehozadak’s son Joshua the high priest, and the spirit of all the rest of the people, so they came and began to work on the house of their God, the Lord of the Heavenly Armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This took place on the twenty-fourth day of the sixth month of the second year of the reign of King Darius.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the twenty-first day of the seventh month, this message from the Lord came by Haggai the prophet:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to Shealtiel’s son Zerubbabel, governor of Judah, to Jehozadak’s son Joshua, the high priest, and to the rest of the people, asking,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Who is left among you who saw this house in its former glory? And what does it look like now? From what you can see, it seems like nothing, doesn’t it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now be strong, Zerubbabel,’ declares the Lord, ‘and be strong, Joshua son of Jehozadak, the high priest, and be strong, all you people of the land,’ declares the Lord. ‘Go to work, because I am with you,’ declares the Lord of the Heavenly Armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘My Spirit continues to dwell among you, according to the covenant I established when you came out from Egypt. Don’t be afraid!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For this is what the Lord of the Heavenly Armies says: ‘Once more, in a little while, I will make the heavens, the earth, the sea, and the dry land to shake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will shake all nations, and the One desired by all nations will come. Then I will fill this house with glory,’ says the Lord of the Heavenly Armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The silver belongs to me, as does the gold,” declares the Lord of the Heavenly Armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The glory of this present house will be greater than was the former,” declares the Lord of the Heavenly Armies. “And in this place I will grant peace,” declares the Lord of the Heavenly Armies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the twenty-fourth day of the ninth month of the second year of the reign of King Darius, this message from the Lord came to Haggai the prophet:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what the Lord of the Heavenly Armies says: ‘Ask the priests about what the Law says:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If a man carries consecrated meat in the folds of his garment, and if his garment touches bread, stew, wine, oil, or any other edible thing, will these things become consecrated?”’”
The priests answered, “No.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So Haggai responded, “If someone who is unclean because of contact with a dead body were to touch any of these things, would they become unclean?”
The priests responded, “They would be unclean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Haggai answered, “‘That’s how I look at this people and this nation,’ declares the Lord. ‘And that’s how it is with everything they undertake and with what they offer there—it is unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pay attention from now on to how things used to be before one stone had been laid upon another in the Temple of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When someone came to a pile of grain to get 20 measures, there were only ten. Or when someone approached the wine press to siphon out 50 measures, there were only 20.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I punished you and everything that you undertook—with scorching wind, with mildew, and with hail, and you still did not return to me,’ declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Pay attention from now on, from this twenty-fourth day of the ninth month, when the foundation of the Lord’s Temple was laid. Pay attention!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is there seed left in the granary? Up until now, neither the vine, the fig tree, the pomegranate, nor the olive tree has borne fruit, but from this very day I will bless you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This message from the Lord came a second time to Haggai on the twenty-fourth day of the month:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to Zerubbabel, governor of Judah. Tell him, ‘I’m going to shake the heavens and the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will overthrow royal thrones. I will annihilate the strength of national governments. I will overthrow chariots along with those who drive them. Both horses and their riders will fall, each one by means of his comrade’s weapon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day,’ declares the Lord of the Heavenly Armies, ‘I will take you, my servant Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel,’ declares the Lord, ‘and I will set you in place like a signet ring. For I have chosen you,’ declares the Lord of the Heavenly Armies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
